data.title: casual, fresh, and delicious
data.text: Sushi Box is not the place to bring the family to celebrate a graduation, but it's a great place for lunch with co-workers. We have a Taiwanese friend and we let her order; I can't say what it is, but it's always been 100% excellent.

data.title: Very Good Korean Food
data.text:
I can vouch for the Korean food here-- jaap chae was a generous well flavored portion with lots of vegetables! Looking forward to trying bulgogi and bi bim bap on future visits!

Miso soup was good and standard fare. Sweet potato sushi were really large and good. Veggie dumplings ok. Dumpling soup was good according to my daughter.

data.title: Sushi not fresh; Korean foods are okay
data.text:
I went to this place since I had a groupon for this. I ordered Sashimi Special ($29.99). The food looked good but it was very fishy. I would not recommend ordering sushi or sashimi from this place; but rather order korean food from this restaurant if you don't want to travel to boston for korean dishes since they are actually "okay". 
If you are planning on purchasing a groupon for this place, they do not accept this groupon for lunch although it is not mentioned in the groupon.

data.title: Rainbow Sushi was Wonderful
data.text: This was our second time there and still just as good as the first time.  We had forgotten about the dinner boxes so had 2 orders of sushi -  The Rainbow Sushi was a great combination.  Pork Katsu and bolgoki were great too.  Had enough for lunch the next day which was perfect.  Having a Groupon was an extra bonus.  Note:  they no longer accept them for lunch anymore. (Big sign on door)

data.title: Sushi in Waltham Center
data.text:
I'm not sure how Sushi Box compares to the other Japanese venues in Waltham, but we found it to be about average compared to other sushi restaurants we've been to. Everything was fresh, prices very reasonable, service was good, but none of the sushi or maki wowed us in any way.  I would consider returning to try some of the non sushi items as there is Korean and Thai choices as well.

The hostess and waitress was super friendly and checked in on us frequently to see if we were happy or needed anything else. 

Note: There is no alcohol served, soft drinks and tea only.

data.title: Fresh and reasonable pricing
data.text:
When it comes to sushi I could be a pain  due to health issues. I have had the love, rainbow and  California  rolls as well as miso soups and all is always fresh. Reasonable price ! The attendant is adorable and service is pretty fast! 

Thank you sushi box for always taking care of my colds with your miso soups :)

data.title: Very rude owner
data.text: I'm a repeat customer of this place because of the good food. And when I saw there was a Groupon, I happily bought it. I made sure there was no restrictions and took my friends there for lunch. However, they refused to take the Groupon and said it can only be used for dinner (which is not on the Groupon at all). Worst part is even the owner came out to yell at us. I half joked that they might lose a repeat customer and they said they don't care. Definitely never going back again.

data.title: Great food - Reasonably Priced
data.text: Had the dinner boxes -  about $17 each -  included salad, 2 pot stickers, onion rings (not sure why!!) and choice of sushi/sashimi and a main entrée.  Food was excellent- very fresh.  Rest of the menu looked interesting.

data.title: Amazing Every Time!
data.text: I discovered this place shortly after our company moved over to Waltham. I missed Boston food and tried this place out. By far better than any other authentic Asian cuisine I have had. I am not so much into the Americanized Chinese food. This is a great place for the real deal.

data.title: Good food at a reasonable price - give it a try.
data.text: Food isn't bad and it is authentic for the most part.  We usually go in for lunch and never have a problem getting a seat.  Not a bad little place.  Staff are very polite and they usually remember us each time we come in. :-)

data.title: Great Korean and Japanese Food
data.text: Best sushi and bento box meal in the area. I've been coming here for several years, despite their name (and/or management) changes and they've always delivered good quality food.  They're not on the cheap side for a meal but it's been very tasty.  If you like scallops, try the Volcano maki (it's cooked). They also have a great bento dinner box that comes with something from both the sushi bar and the kitchen.  Their Korean food is very authentic so you probably won't go wrong w/ any of those menu items.  Their service is not typically super attentive/fast but I don't think they mind being prompted for whatever it is you need (e.g., water refill, etc.).

data.title: Very good food, very nice place
data.text: We've enjoyed quite a few meals at the Sushi Box -  several lunches, a celebratory dinner with family, dinner with friends - and always enjoyed it.  The food is very good; the service is excellent; the restaurant is very pleasant.  It's nice to have a choice between Japanese, Korean and sushi because there's something here for everybody.   The tempura is great; the sushi party boat is great; the kim chee is excellent.  Tonight I had Jaap Chae and it was terrific - fresh vegetables perfectly stir fried with lovely cellophane noodles and beef.  The Una Ju (broiled eel) was also very good.  We'll be back!  They also offer take out and delivery.

data.title: I'm a fan
data.text: Love there sticky rice and cucumber rolls my wife's favorite are the shrimp rolls.the prices are very fair.

data.title: Not bad sushi, but not good either.
data.text: I went here with 3 other colleagues and I was very unimpressed.  We were the ONLY table at 6pm on a Monday night and the service was AWFUL.  The waitress gave us a "I really don't care about you at all" attitude and never refilled my water in over an hour.  We even had to ask her to come over and take our order.  The sushi tasted very 'so-so.'  There was nothing that excited me whatsoever and I was very happy that it was all on the company's dime and not mine.  The sushi was boring.  The restaurant was boring.  And the staff was boring.  I won't go here again on my next trip out.

data.title: OK but no urge to go back
data.text: I have been eating at this location for many years now, under many different owners. It is called the Sushi Box out front at present. I usually get the shrimp and vegetable tempura, with maki and miso. The tempura tasted like older oil and slightly overcooked. Hard to evaluate the batter under these conditions. The miso was heavy and the maki tasted like it had been prepared much earlier. Not bad, just not as good as it had been previously, and the prices were higher. With other, better restaurants nearby, I'll have to have a craving for tempura for my next visit, if Ginger in Bedford is still closed for reconstruction.

data.title: Very good sushi @ Yasu Sushi (GPS) AKA Sushi Box (store sign)
data.text: Visiting son at nearby school and found small sushi restaurant called Yasu Sushi on Gamin GPS. But sign says Sushi Box. Sushi very good and quantity and price reasonable to what I pay in Los Angeles for family-style sushi. We went on a Thursday night and the place was packed. Service adequate. We're going there next time I'm in Waltham visiting my son.

data.title: Great sushi and sashimi
data.text:
My wife and I were visiting in the Boston area lookijng for some sushi. This restaurant was listed as Yasu Sushi in the Garmin but seemed to have been renamed the Sushi Box according to the marquis. We had sushi and sashimi. The sushi was great. Rolls seemed larger than I'm accustomed to and very good. Sashimi was fresh and simply excellent! 
Randy, minneapolis

data.title: Unsuspectingly good sushi. Very fresh.
data.text: Unsuspectingly good sushi. Very fresh.

data.title: Not the best, or the worst, but somewhere on the side of unremarkable. When I think of this place all I want to do is...
data.text: Not the best, or the worst, but somewhere on the side of unremarkable. When I think of this place all I want to do is smile.

data.title: Not exactly yasui (cheap) but worth it
data.text: Yasu is a gem which I can only hope isn't fatally overshadowed by its nearby competitors Carambola and Asian Grill.  The space is small, but much of the business is take-out so there isn't a problem with being seated.  Their sushi is awesome, as are the entrees;  noodle dishes such as "yakisoba" are loaded with vegetables rather than having the noodles overwhelm the plate as happens all too often elsewhere.  Everything I've tried there has been fresh and delicious.  If you eat at the compact sushi bar and other people are there, it's hard to not get drawn into amicable conversation, oftentimes with the manager joining in.   Yasu is a good choice for when you want superior Japanese cuisine at a reasonable price, and have time to savor and socialize.
